title: InDesign font list placement...
content:
Any idea why a font ends up at the very end of InDesign's font menu?   
   
After Z in the menu there is a rule and then the font I'm working on is listing below that line. Anyone know why?
author: jason

comments.content:
InDesign thinks its primary codepage isn't the same as the other fonts in the menu.   
   
What language groups does the font support?   
What format is the font? What OS are you on? What version of InDesign?   
How are you activating the font?   
   
Regards,   
   
T

It's a basic latin font, OpenType, WindowsXP Pro, Indesign CS, activated via Suitcase.   
   
I've cleared the AdobeFnt files and have rebooted, font still showing up at bottom of list.

Hmmm. You're using FontLab to build this? Check which codepages you have declared support for in the Font Info dialog. Maybe you have some more codepages declared than you ought....   
   
T

Thanks for the input Thomas. Still haven't sorted this out. I am using FontLab. Regarding your last note and checking to see that no other codepages are active, do you mean in the Encoding & Unicode section of the Font Info dialogue?   
   
In Supported Codepages and Default Character Set I have only 1252 Latin 1 in the list, and in the Supported Unicode Ranges I have only Basic Latin selected. Does this sound right?   
   
Thanks again for your input...
